snippet: The TV producer who introduced the technology for instant replay never imagined it would be used to help officiate games.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column notes that television producer Tony Verna, who unveiled instant replay in 1963, never intended for the technology to help officiate football games; argues that ever-expanding replay is depriving the NFL of its soul.
lead_paragraph: The TV producer who introduced the technology for instant replay never imagined it would be used to help officiate games.

headline.seo: Relentless Replay Deprives N.F.L. of the Beauty of Imperfection
headline.main: Longing for a Return to the Beauty of Imperfection
headline.print_headline: Longing for a Return to the Beauty of Imperfection
